Reviews.Title: “Positive- great location, Negative- BEDBUGS!!!”
Reviews.Author: offtheground
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located to everything which is the positive thing about this place. When walking into this hotel, you have to climb a flight of stairs. The reception was small and decent, nothing special. So when we arrived they gave us a room on the same floor of the reception, I think it was room 108. We walked through loads of boxes and wet carpet, seems like a storage area. We had a private room, it had 2 twin beds, private bath, great room size, a window that didn't open and a view of car tires in a parking lot. Prior to going to sleep, I was using the laptop and with the glare of the light, I saw a bug going up my chest (and it wasn't a little bug, it was like a size of a roach. My boyfriend informed the manager to request for another room but he said he wanted to see my bites first. Seriously!!! Only if I caught the bug, I would personally hand it to him...So eventually, he was nice enough to accomodate us to another room which was the attic (which had 4 twin beds) and this room was cleaner and it was a shared bathroom. Unfortunately, we had to move to a different room the next day because it was reserved. The other rooms where in a different side of the building in between they money changer. This room was smaller and a bit dusty but had the best view of the city. Windows did open, so I had great ventilation. Honestly, the location is the best and has so much beautiful sites to offer. Unfortunately when I got home, I had a bites on my back due to bedbugs :/. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Pete1609
Reviews.Content: After reading some views on here I nearly cancelled , glad I didn't , great value for money and exelent location, clean bedding and bathroom

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs, homeless man INSIDE corridor!!”
Reviews.Author: Selecta L
Reviews.Content: this was horrible. the room i stayed in was just a box with a bed. no window, it was stuffy and smelt damp. the bed looked clean with white bedding, i inspected before i slept in it and then decided that i would have to sleep fully clothed. the hotel reception isnt in the same building. i stayed here for two nights alone. both nights i got in at 12.30/1.00am - u have to buzz to get into the building, once i buzzed to get thru the door i was greated by a sleeping homeless man on cardboard at the bottom of the stairs. this man MUST of buzzed to get in and there are cameras inside the building, so reception must of let him in. he was their both nights. on my final day i woke up with 9 or 10 bites. these bites swelled to the size of a 2p coin. everything was bad about this place, apart from the location. i would rather pay an extra 10 euros for a better gaff on the same strip.

Reviews.Title: “AT YOUR OWN RISK - stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Mariel S
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with friends over the new year break. We were overcharged and the heating didnt work. Even after complaining a few times about the heat they did nothign. They didnt even say they were going to fix it - they said at 9 degrees C it was warm outside. 9 is NOT WARM. that is cold our bathroom had no window and no fan so was constantly wet. horrible place. stay there at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “Quick City Break...”
Reviews.Author: Dubland_Trav
Reviews.Content: Well, if your just in AMS for a short weekend break, this is a good base and if it's your first time in the City then its easy to find, 2 mins from the Central Station and Dam Square, plenty of shops and restaurants close by.. The rooms were clean and towels/bed clothes changed each day, friendly reception staff, spoke English fine too... Now for the negative, it's basic, very basic, use only as a place to leave your luggage and to catch a sleep before spending the whole day out in the City.. Although It's a "budget" hotel, It's quite pricey and I would recommend spending a bit extra for a nicer hotel unless your travelling with mates for a short stay..

Reviews.Title: “Don't judge a book by its' cover!”
Reviews.Author: Pozitiv
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Orange Tulip hotel from the 9th through the 12th of August 2011. I found this place while searching for a decently priced hotel right in the heart of the Damrak. When I first arrived to the hotel it looked like I had made a bad decision. It was barely visible, snuggled amongst restaurants and stores. There was one small entry way with a small sign which was the only evidence that this hotel was actually there. The first thing that greets you when walking through the doorway was a steep staircase. This leads to a small lobby which contains a reception, computer that is used for internet (which wasn't functioning during my stay), and bathrooms that are frequently visited by the customers from the restaurant below. After checking in, I made my way to the second floor where my room was located. There isn't an elevator in the hotel so again I had to walk up a steep and cramped staircase which can be difficult if you have heavy luggage. I felt sorry for my friend who had a huge bag and was located on the third floor. I finally made it to my room and once I entered I wasn't disappointed. The main and obvious drawback of the room is the size. It is quite small but is still comfortable. There is enough space to put your luggage and move around. The bed is twin sized however is extremely comfortable. The bathroom is smaller than I'm used to however I did have plenty of room to utilize the facilities. They had a small plasma TV hanging on the wall with a few channels however the signal seemed to have had some issues. There weren't many issues and the issues that were present were minor. I was very impressed with the cleanliness of the hotel particularly in the rooms themselves. Every morning to early afternoon you can find about three people working diligently to make sure the hotel is spotless. From vacuuming the carpeted staircases to scrubbing your bathroom floor. The hotel does have free wi-fi but you have to be in the lobby for it to work. I found this hotel to be a little expensive but compared to hotels in the surrounding area it is a great deal. Looking out my window I could see the infamous Grasshopper coffee shop. The price and location definitely make the few small things I had issues with tolerable. I would stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs. (!)”
Reviews.Author: ScoutsG1
Reviews.Content: Okay. First it's in the middle of the red light district. What means it's loud and dirty there. If you are going to Amsterdam just for the dope that may be cool for you, but otherwise it sucks. It's waaaay overpriced. 47â‚¬ for a small (4m2 room and a small 2m bath!) You can get an 3* B&B for less. (near van Gogh museum for example.) But that's not the worst thing about this "hostel". In our room were a lot of bed bugs (!!!!) That's freaking disgusting! At least they gave us the money back. We found an B&B in the museum district. Same price. About 3 times the size of our room. Friendly staff. Clean! And great breakfast. But I wouldn't recommend this hostel to anyone. It's loud, dirty, overpriced and there are bed bugs (!) DO NOT STAY THERE.

Reviews.Title: “Everything in Amsterdam is small.”
Reviews.Author: pouncingpanda
Reviews.Content: The price for the location was really good. Which is why my husband and I choose it. Well... I guess the main issue was there was a mouse in our room. There was a no food sign and now we know why. We were backpacking so of course we are going to have some food on us and that little guy found it around 4 in the morning and boy was he a jumper. We only stayed a night or two so we didn't bring notice and the little guy only visited the last night we were there. There were chunks of the wall missing too... makes you wander who was there before haha. The hotel was really small but I just think that is how Amsterdam is. I think our bathroom was half the size of the whole room. There was only room for a double bed and a closet. The view was a couple floors up right on the street and we got to see a lot or people wander by. Free internet was definitely a plus. Even though the location was great for the price, I'm sure you can find something else in the area that doesn't have mice alarm clocks.

Reviews.Title: “rooms”
Reviews.Author: annchan0806
Reviews.Content: Compare to the room rate which was 72.5 Euro per night (exclusive the city tax) the rooms' size was really small and smell badly.

Reviews.Title: “fair enough for amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: atilamanager
Reviews.Content: Good location just close to central station, lots of noise from the street and staff that terribly speaks english.... the room was quite clean, I paid for double-bed despite I stay alone just because my last experience in A'dam with shared room was traumatic... fair enough for staying in Amsterdam, unless you want to spend tons of money to book a real hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Leatkin2
Reviews.Content: In February 2010, myself and 9 other friends travelled to Amsterdam for a short break. We had originally booked into the Damrak inn but upon arrival we were told that they were fully booked. The hotel offered us alternative accomadation just a few doors down at the Orange Tulip Hotel. Baring in mind we had only paid Â£20 each for the night, we were not expecting much. When arriving at the hotel, we were faced with the daunting walk up the steep steps with our luggage. Although we arrived earlier than the stated time for check in, we were given our keys and allowed to enter our rooms as long as the cleaners had finished cleaning. The rooms were small but did have an en suite. The room did smell of something funny but it wasnt too far from the canal so we ignored it and soon got used to it! The room was relatively clean and was convenient for our type of trip. On depature the next day, the hotel manager allowed us to leave our luggage if we wanted to but instead to be on the safe side we took it to the Central Station and placed it in the luggage lockers there. If you are a group of friends just needing somewhere to sleep for the night without all the luxuries, then this hotel is fine and very cheap. It is very close to all the tourist sites such as the Red Light District and the Central Station. I wouldnt recommend staying much longer than a night as it's not the best hotel in the city

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay there!”
Reviews.Author: capo06
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel. I was booked for 2 nights but had to check out after the first night being kept awake by the other people in this hotel till 4am...when i complained (the next day) as there is no phone in the room and you have to go outside in the main street and back 2 doors up to find reception!!! Advised that i needed to check out and gave reasons - was told: 'we are sorry but no refund - if you had told us last night we would have got the police to throw the other people out!' Nice. but not sorry enough to give me a refund. the worst value for money i have ever seen. there is nothing good about this hotel - DO NOT STAY THERE! I haven't even gone into the smell in the bathroom, the hairs in the bathroom, the TV that doesn't work, no hangers, no staff to ask anything, (no phone in room). The only good thing - i got out of there alive (just!)

Reviews.Title: “Only if you are desperate with no place else to stay.”
Reviews.Author: PatyMedeiros
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night which was more than enough. The room was clean, but very old and expensive . Wanted to cry when I saw the stairs. Also no air conditioning, so impossible to stay in the summer. We wanted to go out at night and around 9 pm we heard somebody trying to open our door. Later on the receptionist asked us if we were staying with some man in the room, since he saw a guy trying to open the door. Anyway we decided to go out to enjoy the city at night, but we were afraid for our belongs.But hopefully nothing bad happened. The location is great, we could not complain about that. We stayed there cause all hotels and even hostels were fully booked, otherwise we had gone to another place.

Reviews.Title: “One word - BEDBUGS!!”
Reviews.Author: hum01
Reviews.Content: So many things wrong with this hotel it's hard to know where to start. But the fact that is has bedbugs is the most importantâ€¦ I was bitten a few times the 1st night. I complained and was moved to another room. On the 2nd morning I woke up with nearly 50 bites all over my body. I checked out and found another hotel. The hotel staff tried to imply it was not a problem of the hotel but that the previous occupant of my room had been from South America and must be responsible for the bed bugs!! So not only a dirty hotel but racist staff aswell... I would not stay in this hotel ever again. I would not recommend this hotel. It is dirty, smelly and has absolutely no amenities. Even the promised free WIFI did not work. The only positive I can dredge up is the location. Everything else about this hotel is simply disgustingâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Dingy and Depressing!”
Reviews.Author: jenniemcn
Reviews.Content: The best advice I can give is - DON'T STAY HERE!! It's the most depressing place. So much so my boyfriend and I did all we could to stay out for as long as possible! So the journey begins with a really narrow staircase, where the steps are all uneven so beware, and then you are greeted by a man, whose face has never seen a smile before, on reception. He will ask you for your passport so he can take a copy (apparently this is normal in Amsterdam). Everything is a grey, dull colour in the reception and our room was no different. As we entered our room, the dark grey curtains were shut and we basically had 2 camp beds pushed together. We had those itchy brown (at least it wasn't grey) camping sheets as duvets. We actually kept the curtains closed after looking at our view (another wall and some pipes) so we understood why they were shut in the first place. I was terrified to open the bathroom door, but as my expectations were so low, it wasn't as bad as I thought it was going to be. It was very squashed and the door didn't shut properly, but I couldn't find any bugs or anything. The only good thing about this hotel is the location! It's so close to the station and near loads of coffee shops and restaurants so that is a bonus. All in all I would recommend everyone to look elsewhere - for the price, it's not worth it! If this was cheap, it wouldn't be so bad, but it is not cheap as 2 star hotels go. There was another hotel about 5 minutes away where our friends were staying and their one was cheaper and soooo much cleaner and brighter. I can't remember the name of that one, but if you have the Orange Tulip Hotel behind you, there is a road ahead of you (slightly to the right) with loads of bikes parked on it - go down that road and you will stumble across another road to your right.Go down that road - there should be a big cafe with outdoor seating on the corner. Keep walking right and you'll come across a hotel with quite a big reception area and a separate door with a flight of stairs leading up to the rooms. If you have any questions - feel free to message me! Have a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdamaged”
Reviews.Author: gould321
Reviews.Content: we were moved here due to the damrack inn being burnt down. this was the worst hotel in the world. bugs, stong smell of pee and for a room of 7 they set 6 beds up and left a mattress on the floor for the 7th bed, room was that small you had to stand all over the bed on the floor to get to the other beds! for a few(not alot) more euros please stay at the westcord city center.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo”
Reviews.Author: Rimodi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not bad as the reviews say here. We were a group of 15 persons, stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The rooms were clean, our towels are changed every day. Soap, shampoo, cups are all inclusive, very nice. I travelled before in Amsterdam, not all hotels have soap, shampoo etc included. Also the location is amazing....we love Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “O M F G !!!”
Reviews.Author: Hunter006
Reviews.Content: Never stayed here myself but as a member of a stag doo i had the pleasure of visiting people staying here. I would rather sleep on the bench outside the hotel. Dont take my word for it but if you deside to stay, take clothes that you can either leave behide or burn before your return. I dont think that Pets are not allowed ,Well thats not including the ones they provide. We stayed in the PRINS HENDRICK Go there they are clean. UNCLEAN LOCATION IS REIGHT IN THE MIDDLE OF THE MAIN STREET ROOMS ARE BAD SERVICE?? VALUE ( I WOULDNT PAY FOR THIS) SLEEP QUALITY (YOUVE GOT TO BE WASTED TO STAY HERE SO PROBABLY GOOD) Hope that ive help.

Reviews.Title: “Ghastly - rip off central!”
Reviews.Author: NMHogg
Reviews.Content: Seriously overpriced, tiny room, smelly, dirty & cigarette burnt sheets. Truly revolting. Avoid at all costs - or unless the ash cloud comes back, like it did for us. Damrak is not the place to stay. Best thing about it? The 2 minute walk to the station to get out of there the next morning!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: jnismith
Reviews.Content: Well my friend booked the hotel without my having read the reviews, so I was a little worried when I read them. I was even more worried when another friend who was staying in Amsterdam told me it looked like a dump. But hey, I thought 40 Euros for a single room with shower. So up the windy stairs to the small reception, all pretty grotty, then they gave us the two rooms off reception, facing the street. My room was pretty minute with a bunk bed, a table and 2 chairs, a washbasin and a shower room with toilet. It looked like it had been painted in the last year and was clean. Went straight out and came back at midnight, bed was comfortable. However there was a lot of noise from the street which kept me awake. Some of this was my fault however as I forgot to close the window. Got up in the morning, nice hot shower and left again. So for 40 Euros I got a clean comfortable bed and hot shower in a good location. Can't ask for much more than that

Reviews.Title: “ok to stay”
Reviews.Author: koowaka
Reviews.Content: I and my friends only stay there two nights, we have enjoy there. room was ok, just little bit small,good bathroom was clean. we got everything needs. reception looks like poor, first looking was not so good, rest was ok to stay. I recommand it.

Reviews.Title: “Burn this place to the ground, BIOHAZARD”
Reviews.Author: A140
Reviews.Content: There is only one thing anyone need know about this place, DO NOT ENTER. I had the misfortune of arriving in amsterdam one evening back during some football match , no hotel rooms, suites anything, this was the last resort besides a boat and now I wish I'd just hired a car and slept in it. This is one stinking hole in the ground. I know as my husband is dutch that ther are better and cheaper places to stay in amsterdam. I think anyone who stays here and enjoys it is mental

Reviews.Title: “Rats...Bed bugs...DON'T GO!!!”
Reviews.Author: Travellerx2Uk
Reviews.Content: Great location and reasonable price however the room and bathroom was filthy dirty. There were rats and bed bugs in the room. Definately will not go there again. Would not recommend it to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Did the job!”
Reviews.Author: Shaz4T
Reviews.Content: I went to Amsterdam with my cousin and stayed at this hotel. It is very basic but our room was spotless and so were the sheets, we had clean towels on a daily basis and the housekeeping guys were very pleasant and helpful (when we locked ourselves out)! The stairs are very narrow and steep and a lot of them. Our room was on the front overlooking the street so it was lovely, it was a family room (307), we paid Â£200 for 3 nights for the two of us so overall a BLOODY GOOD WEEKEND.

Reviews.Title: “bedbug heaven”
Reviews.Author: emilius81
Reviews.Content: Apart from the location, which is the only good thing about this hotel(?), as itÂ´s in the very centre of amsterdam a couple of minutes' walk from central station, i would highly recommend to look for any other place to stay, except you fancy your city trip being ruined by the fact that youÂ´re covered from head to toe with itching and fiery red bedbug bites (this is NO fun), and being let down by the completely uninterested staff...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: abmaster
Reviews.Content: Me and my 3 friends from university all meet up in Amsterdam (our first time) at the start of July. I was a little nervous about the place, due to all the poor reviews - but i have to say our stay was perfect! They booked us in a room with 4 beds, private bathroom and fresh towels everyday. They even hooked us up with a balcony over looking the busy street, great people watching :D Ok so the stairway was slim and tight and hard to walk up when you have had a few, but for 120 euros per night - it was great. I really recommend staying there! Remember your in Europe, and you get a hotel on a busy street, with rest. and shopping everywhere - great value for money!!

Reviews.Title: “If this is the last place on earth, sleep on the pavement”
Reviews.Author: NH1964
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as it was close to the station. It was 85 degrees outside so we were looking forward to getting out of the heat and into the room. Little did we know that the rooms would be 10 degrees hotter than the weather outside. I was 'confined' to a room at the back of the hotel and found that the window opens onto a cental shaft. Therefore no fresh air to circulate through the room. The only blessing was that the shower worked. One night in this 'hotel' (?????) is more than enough for anyone especially in the summer. As my colleague said it was no more than a hostel and a bad one at that. If you are on a budget save yourself some money and book a proper hostel, not a hostel pretending to be a hotel. If you have â‚¬90 to spend a night on a room look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “MIGHT AS WELL HAVE BEEN A HOSTEL”
Reviews.Author: cmesser3
Reviews.Content: Great location but not worth the money, really dirty, customer service was horrible, had to carry my luggage up 3 flights of stairs in a narrow hallway, Bathrooms were disgusting, Bugs in the room, Might as well have been a hostel, DO NOT STAY HERE

Reviews.Title: “THis is not fit to be called a hotel”
Reviews.Author: theladwandering
Reviews.Content: We had to haul our bags up the stairs as the elevator did not go to the ground floor. The rooms were dirty furnised with bunkbeds, not proper beds. We did not stay there we chanjged to adifferent hotel. hwever, we had prepaid through Exppedia so we lost our money. This hotel is not fit to me a college dorm.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of scary”
Reviews.Author: etbwatson
Reviews.Content: Apparently we were in Amsterdam during a busy time, since many of the hotels were getting booked fast, we found this one which was a decent price. This is in an excellend location, very close to the train station and in walking distance of other sites like Anne Franks house and the Red Light District. When we arrived we had to use stairs to get to the second floor, where the front desk was and the hallways were very narrow. When we got to our room, it was very dark and small. Our window looked out to a rooftop, so there was NO view. The bathroom was small and you had to squeeze by the toilet to get to the shower. When we wanted to use the phone we had to go back to the front desk and use theirs because there was no phone in the room. For the price, I expected a little better. Needless to say, we were only in the room to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel possible”
Reviews.Author: margQueensland
Reviews.Content: I would strongly advise against using this hotel. We arrived in Amsterdam in November after having booked online 2 months prior. After squeezeing up the narrow steep stairs with our luggage, we entered a shocking hovel. The receptionist gave us keys to a room which was big enough for one person to stand in with their luggage. There were 2 of us with 2 x suitcases, we had to put the cases on the bed then squeeze in to shut the door, then put the cases into the shower/toilet room to move. It was filthy and very noisey. We were advised they were doing alterations, hence some of the noise and mess, This room should not have been rented out to anybody and we strongly told them so, they said the fact of doing renovations was the problem. Sorry we booked months in advance we should have been notified. Upon some time spent discussing it all Sabrina (from reception) found us another hotel close by. I notice other people have commented on their luggage hold - it is in their reception seating area with no security at all. Do not leave anything there. Avoid the heart ache and dissapointement, even though it is close to the train station, just dont go there.

Reviews.Title: “No Dice Folks ...”
Reviews.Author: Siobhan1983
Reviews.Content: Well, to be completely honest, I donâ€™t know where to begin. I literally burst out laughing when I realized The Orange Tulip had landed itself on tripadvisor.com. I want to start this review by saying that I am not a difficult lady to please. Letâ€™s start at the beginning!! I wound up staying at the Orange Tulp, not the Orange Tulip, as the â€œIâ€� was not evident in the sign. The first thing I noticed was the bags, upon bags, of garbage that graced the front door of the hotel. I felt a little worried at that point, but I figured its Amsterdam, and itâ€™s not that big of a deal. I had seen photos of the hotel, so I felt okay walking into the situation. There is a ridiculous amount of stairs. Very narrow stairs. I had trouble maneuvering up them, and Iâ€™m a small girl. There is a lot of stairs. We counted and the total number of narrow stairs to our â€œhotel roomâ€� was 87. Yip, 87 stairs, after exploring a city all day is rough. Check in was easy. The staff was friendly enough. But, I only stayed one day, and that was our only interaction with the staff, so I canâ€™t really speak on how great or lack there of, they are. So, 87 narrow stairs later, we get to our â€œhotel roomâ€�. I use quotes every time I write â€œhotel roomâ€� because; it was far from a hotel room. It was a disgusting square of walls that magically contained 4 beds. It was small. Really small!! There was also absolutely no view. Iâ€™m not kidding when I say there was MOULD on the walls, on the baseboards. There was no washroom in the room, only a communal washroom down the hall. (Actually downstairs, and down the hall, as that once we unlocked the door to the room, there was another flight of stairs that brought us to the attic). The washroom was the most disgusting, vile room Iâ€™ve ever seen in my life. I backpacked through Europe, and stayed in hostels, and a couple great hotels, and a couple AWFUL hotels. This one, by far, took the cake. This is a list of the things that were included in the shower room: mould, dirty boxers, hair all over the floor, and hair ties, and whatnot. The water was cold. It smelled like it hadnâ€™t been washed in about a month. The toilet room was worse. It smelled worse, had slightly more mould, and actually made me sick to my stomach. This was a year and a half ago, and every now and then the girls and I will still burst out laughing about this â€œhotel roomâ€�. The bed sheets did look brand new, but the beds were really uncomfortable. If I can give you one piece of advice, book elsewhere. Itâ€™s not even that cheap, we paid like 50 bucks Canadian each for one night â€¦ so 200.00 Canadian for the room a night â€¦ honestly, you can do better. We were worried the entire time about getting toxic mould from our â€œhotel roomâ€�. And, that is something that you should never worry about.

Reviews.Title: “saver to stay outside”
Reviews.Author: fatboy2000
Reviews.Content: stairs were black with dirt , landing tiles with holes,smell of pee rooms were small, dirty .and the curtins not on the rails there was no safe will never be BACK

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever seen in my whole life”
Reviews.Author: sderone
Reviews.Content: A hotel to avoid at all cost!!! When you arrive at the hotel, you are greeted with filthy stairs leading up to a less than welcoming reception. The corridors smelt of urine. When we finally saw the room, we immediately concluded we could not stay a minute longer in that hotel. The bed was disgusting, cockroaches were crawling on the floor and the bathroom looked unhygienic. The receptionist was sympathetic but said he could not issue a refund. He said they were getting complaints all the time but the owner was not doing anything about it. We asked if it was worth speaking to the manager but he said it wouldn't get us our money back. We lost our prepaid two nights, but decided to cut our losses and move to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: jwzest
Reviews.Content: The Orange Tulip was a huge disappointment. I booked a room there because the location seemed great, and the hotel's website promised a cozy room at a really good price. I was looking for something simple, clean and affordable. What I found was more like a prison room that hadn't been cleaned for a while, with a very questionable bed spread and a shower head over the toilet. When I complained, the receptionist told me this was my only option. There was no way I would stay in that room - not just because it was awful, but also because it was very much not the room they promised. After the receptionist refused to refund my deposit, I talked to the manager on the phone and tried to explain what happened. He was much less polite than the receptionist. I've never experienced such rude service. In the end, I left. Without my money, but with the hope for finding clean sheets somewhere for the night.

Reviews.Title: “below par”
Reviews.Author: Borislondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 years ago and am reminded of the stay as I was recently in Amsterdam again and stayed at a much nicer place. I find this hotel absolutely horrible. Terrible location (nothing nice about the Damrack!) dirty & noisy. I requested a room change when they assigned me one of the noisy threadbare rooms facing the street, and I paid dearly for it. In the end it wasn't even cheap. I also found a dead slug on my bedspread (no joke) and threw the bedspread on the floor, and everyday it was put back on the bed, complete with slug. The bathroom was clean, the sheets were cleanish - but I found the carpet, furniture, and blankets filthy, as were the stairs... Also very noisy with people coming any going all night. I look back on that stay with horror....

Reviews.Title: “Rude restaurant staff!”
Reviews.Author: irishgirl2008
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 nights in amsterdam. I suppose the best thing to say about this hotel is you get what you pay for. The stairs are very steep and hard to manouvre but upon check in and check out someone carried our bags for us. The staff at reception were fairly friendly and helpful. The restaurant downstairs is the main drawback, the staff are very rude and on the 2 mornings that we got breakfast there we were charged extra even though breakfast was supposed to be included in the price of the hotel. They didnt tell us this at the time it was only when we were leaving the hotel that the staff on reception presented us with the bill, we felt like criminals! In general its an ok place to stay, the rooms are clean but basic. The whole place could do with a facelift but its in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money... great location!”
Reviews.Author: Stephen&Gemma
Reviews.Content: For the money we paid for this hotel it was absolutely perfect. It was the first stop on a tour of Europe and things couldnâ€™t have been easier. The hotel is a 5 min walk away from the train stationâ€¦ (the main train station is half hour train journey from the airport). It is on the very central â€œDamrakâ€� which is in the middle of everything. You have red light district a ten min walk away, Anne Frank house in walking distance and everything else really. We got breakfast included and the staff seemed nice enoughâ€¦ our room was average size.. the lighting was poor in the room and the TV broke and we had a view of a pile of abandoned tables and chairs but none of this bothered usâ€¦ we were out most of the day and happy to have a quite room rather than a room with a view and a lot of noise. If I went back to Amsterdam I would definitely stay here I think because it was very reasonable and perfect place to crash out and get a peaceful sleep in the heart of the Dam.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: DingDing2k
Reviews.Content: Truly awful. There were 5 of use staying in a room on the top floor. The place was unkempt. There were no redeeming feature whatsoever. There was plenty of grafitti on the walls in our room!! The staff were pretty chilled out though, but I guess that's how a lot of people are in Amsterdam. All in all, this "hotel" is grim.

Reviews.Title: “luggage stolen inside the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laely
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 11am and the room wasnt ready yet. So we left our luggages at the reception. We came back 2 hours later, and then we noticed that one of our two bags have been stolen from the reception. The hotel didn't want to take any responsability. We spent the rest of the day calling our insurance, at the police station, or waiting for the manager to look at the security camera recordings, on which he never found anything mysteriously.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Avoid”
Reviews.Author: jimbo_online
Reviews.Content: The hotel is sitauted above a restaurant, decent location from the train station though (about 2 minutes walk). To get into the hotel lobby you have to walk up a very narrow and steep staircase. We checked in a few hours early and we're allowed to leave our bags at our own risk in the very crampt hotel lobby. There was a dodgy high shelf bundled with other bags where we also left ours! Our room was situated on the top floor which meant carrying our bags/suitcases up and down a few flights of very narrow stairs again as there wasn't a lift. The room was for 3 people and was tiny. You couldn't really stand between the beds. The shower room was just a wet room, however the tiles were manky and grimey. There wasn't even a basin to put your feet. The balcony just outside out room door was full up with what looked like old room fittings etc. There were old toilets, sinks and various other buidling materials there. On the plus side the TV worked!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky but OK”
Reviews.Author: shantyjohn
Reviews.Content: Quirky little place, half way down Damrak between Central Station and Dam Square. The hotel is set above a restaurant with a side entrance and steep, narrow, twisting staircases. The beds are clean, you get cable TV (original All Creatures Great and Small, nightly!) and breakfast in the restaurant is included. English speaking staff as in most of Holland. Good value at 70 euro for a double/twin including breakfast and a great location in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel, OK for single women travellers”
Reviews.Author: JunoUK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights when I went to a conference. The rooms were clean (although bed linen was bit threadbare) and the receptionists were all hugely friendly and helpful. I was travelling alone and felt completely safe at the hotel. The rooms were cleaned daily. I also found the restaurant staff friendly: they introduced me to the hotel cat ("Gato"), who sat with me at breakfast purring away. It was a bit noisy on the Damrak but the hotel have no control over that.

Reviews.Title: “Verrrrry basic”
Reviews.Author: emmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room at this hotel as we wanted something cheap & central. We expected it to be basic - but not that basic! We were ushered through the restauraunt & up the scarily steep 3 stair flight to our room. It was small, which was fine, but you could hardly fit in the bathroom, where the light buzzed & flickered. The beds were hard, the sheets rough & covered in stains & fag burns. The 'chairs' were stools & the TV didn't work. The towels were grey tea towels & the wardrobe door didn't shut. We were bored of the breakfast by the 3rd morning of our 7 night stay. I asked for tea every morning & got coffee. We bombed it off by the 4th & had KFC instead! The hotel is central & subsequently very noisy. The convenience of the location is the best thing about it but I did feel a liitle cheated by the price of it still. I am staying somewhere else this year which seems much nicer & homlier with more impressive reviews - and it's only a few euros more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again !!”
Reviews.Author: syd_gay
Reviews.Content: Dirty place (stairs, lobby area and room) great location (5 mins away frm central station), Very Noisy Friendly and helpfull receptionists Restaurant staff very rude and made me feel like a beggar to have my breakfast !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff !!!”
Reviews.Author: Dragan_1980
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel from July 3d till 7th and overall I can say that I enjoyed my stay. The reception staff was very nice and helpful, my room was clean yet very basic but had everything I needed, the breakfast was ok a typical continental breakfast. The best about this hotel is the location!!! Youâ€™re in the middle of everything what is going on in Amsterdam and the staff provides me with all kinds of information about clubbing and great events they send me to!!! So I had a great time in Amsterdam and would recommend this hotel to all young clubbers who want to be in the very heart of Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune of staying at this 'hotel' (that's what they call it anyway) last week. It is disgusting! I awoke to find I was bitten to death by bugs that were in my bed. It was horrible. Since then I have had an allergic reaction so am covered in lumps. We tried to get a refund for the rest of the time we were there (as we were NOT staying there a moment longer). The manager was both rude and totally unhelpful. He wanted to move us to a different room - we said no. He would only refund us 50% of our money. We took it in the end just to get out of the place but I wanted to warn others that it's really a scumhole. Please dont give them the business, they don't deserve it!! I will upload pics of my bites when I can!!

Reviews.Title: “Should be called hostel at the most”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all I wouldnâ€™t call it hotel, but rather a cheep hostel (not according to the price we paid though (ca. 100 EUR per night)). They claim that rooms are small (thatâ€™s truth) and very clean. The latter is very doubtful fact, because I was bit every night more and more by some bug, spider or I donâ€™t know what, obviously living in the room. I had such a bad reaction to those bites, that I couldnâ€™t have stayed one night longer and immediately when I came back home I had to take pills against the allergic reaction. The recovery in order be able to leave my home and go to work (or to any public place) took one week. This bad experience does not confirm their statement about tidiness. Towels were indescribable colors from washing, I assume. Blankets and pillows were better avoid touching at all - dirty from using, with burn and spit marks on them. Only white bed linen looked clean. No comments about furniture, if those remains of some things could be called furniture at all. Cleaning stuff was showing whenever, leaving strange sets of clean towels, for instance 2 big and 1 small; 2 big ones; no change at all, etc. The room was very small, indeed. Furthermore, the doors to the rooms are so thin that it is no doubt if someone would lean on a bit harder, they would easily break. The light from corridor was coming through all night long. Furthermore every sound was as everything would have been happening in our room - the door was not able to stop neither: the light or sound and, in fact, did not give any feeling of safety. The window view was to the roof where many chairs (assumingly from the bar downstairs, which serves breakfast) are stored. One morning we woke up from the big noise - there were people taking some of those chairs somewhere, fortunately not directly through our room. The breakfast was simply awful. There was no service, food (when it finally arrived) was far from good, and I will put it simply as it was - bad. First we got to choose coffee, tea or juice. I am used to Scandinavian breakfast type, where you take coffee with juice for the start, plus as much as you wish. But there it meant one OR the other, so we got 1 cup of some drink (they called it coffee) and 1 glass of juice for two persons. Then, after a long time sitting and waiting at a dirty table (which I cleaned myself) came food. No menu, no choice, as you might guess. And the taste was according to the service provided. When I asked about menu (not much else was to do while waiting, so I decided to find out what we are waiting for exactly) and why they did not say we get only one drink each, bartender said that we didnâ€™t actually asked about their rules and put it so that our breakfast is "on the house", though we paid for it since it was included in the payment for the hotel. Anyway, it was clear that why to try harder if they already received our money. We did not eat at that place ever again, but went to have breakfast in town instead. The smell of the entire place is some mix of toilet and cigarettes, like in a cheep public toilet at some train station (not every). Not surprisingly after we discovered that people from so called restaurant, where obviously is no toilet, run to the toilet at the reception. This discovery ruined any rests of feeling about being safe in a hotel (even like this). One positive thing was that our room was one staircase up. The staircase where I barely managed to carry my one weekâ€™s luggage up... In short, the hotel experience was the worst I have ever had and the sickness those bites gave me shadowed our otherwise wonderful trip. We will definitely never go back to this hotel and, in fact, I am concerned how I book hotel in the future - in descriptions most of them look if not good than at least ok, but in reality it can vary, unfortunately. I donâ€™t understand how this one can be called a hotel and where from it got two stars, when actually in reality it looks like one of the cheapest hostels. The owner does not want to invest anything in renovation that at least would bring it to some bearable order. I would call such type of living as we had there experience on own risk, just no rain because we still had a roof above us. I believe you get the picture and thank you for asking to share this.

Reviews.Title: “Yak - book at your peril!”
Reviews.Author: stop-the-pigeon
Reviews.Content: Stopped two nights - 25th October 2005. Horrid dirty hotel ... only bonus is its opposite the Grasshopper so at least you can get totally out of your tree and not notice where you put your head! The hotel staff are unhelpful and insolent and cant really be bothered with looking up to acknowledge you whilst they have their phone surgically attached to their head. Tiny dangerous stairs to negotiate to the upper floors. Door bangs on the side of the bed when you open it! You have to be a contortionist to sit on the toilet (its half positioned under the sink). Rooms are tatty and dated. Bed had a stained mattress cover, one sheet and one blanket. We went to bed and woke up under the sheet not realising until we woke up that we were lying on a stained protector. i looked behind me and found that we had been sleeping on pillows that had no cases on them .... Yak they were drool stained! The famous grill and steakhouse is probably only famous for being rubbish! You have to give them your little bit of paper on entering the room. They tell you what you are eating - no choice - eat this or starve! Two slices toast, scrambled egg, slice ham, slice cheese, sachet jam. And one drink. This place is advertised elsewhere as a hostel - and this is all its good as! Bonuses? within sight of central station, the grasshopper and the red light district. in the heart of everything. Word of warning ... check and get in writing from the hotel confirmation of your booking. this place seems to work on a first come first served - or you may find yourself in the white tulip hostel. We turned up and the girl on reception denyed all knowledge of our booking. It was only when i showed her my confirmation email from the 'hotel' that suddenly our booking appeared again. Enter at your peril!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Orange Tulip Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Damrak 32, Amsterdam 1012 LK, The Netherlands
